alert.note: Alert for Knox; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 9:54PM EDT until March 17 at 6:40AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River from Montezuma to Mount Carmel. White River from Edwardsport to Hazleton. .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the White and Wabash Rivers due to rainfall the weekend before last. Minor flooding is occurring, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. The crest on the Wabash is between Vincennes and Mount Carmel. The crest on the White is near Petersburg and Hazleton. The last of the flooding on the lower reaches of the Wabash and White Rivers is expected to end late Friday into early Saturday. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, High water surrounds elevated river cabins. County roads to these cabins are impassable. Agricultural flooding is in progress. Seep water develops behind levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Monday /9:00 PM EDT Monday/ the stage was 18.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Monday /9:00 PM EDT Monday/ was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon and continue falling to 8.6 feet Thursday, March 24. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by 1200 PM EDT Tuesday.
